docs.abstract: The plan sets the stage for a battle with the pharmaceutical industry, which announced earlier that it would not show prices but would direct viewers to company websites that featured the information.
docs.snippet: The plan sets the stage for a battle with the pharmaceutical industry, which announced earlier that it would not show prices but would direct viewers to company websites that featured the information.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Over vehement objections by drug companies, the Trump administration proposed on Monday a new federal regulation that would require them to disclose the list prices of prescription drugs in their television advertisements.

headline.main: Trump Rule Would Compel Drug Makers to Disclose Prices in TV Commercials
headline.print_headline: Rule Would Compel Drug Makers To Disclose Prices in Commercials

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America

docs.abstract: Lawmakers, who along with President Trump have promised to address rising drug prices, pressed the heads of major drug companies to lower prices or risk legislative action.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers, who along with President Trump have promised to address rising drug prices, pressed the heads of major drug companies to lower prices or risk legislative action.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Pharmaceutical executives, testifying before Congress, could not readily explain on Tuesday why the prices for many brand-name prescription drugs were much higher in the United States than in other developed countries.

headline.main: Drug Makers Try to Justify Prescription Prices to Senators at Hearing
headline.print_headline: Drug Makers Try to Justify Higher Costs at Hearing

docs.abstract: Businesses had plenty of reasons to worry in the first half — from slowing economic growth to geopolitical tensions — but they looked beyond those factors to strike big deals at a record pace.
docs.snippet: Businesses had plenty of reasons to worry in the first half — from slowing economic growth to geopolitical tensions — but they looked beyond those factors to strike big deals at a record pace.
docs.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

headline.main: $2 Trillion Worth of Deals Were Struck in the First Half of 2019, but Caution Crept In
headline.print_headline: Report Shows $2 Trillion  In New Deals Worldwide, But Also Signs of Caution

docs.abstract: A rush of transactions is transforming the industry, as blockbuster medicines lose patent protection. The latest acquisition cost AbbVie 16 percent of its share price.
docs.snippet: A rush of transactions is transforming the industry, as blockbuster medicines lose patent protection. The latest acquisition cost AbbVie 16 percent of its share price.
docs.lead_paragraph: A rush of acquisitions this year is reshaping the drug industry. But investors haven’t universally welcomed the deal-making.

headline.main: Drugmaker Deals Are Near Record Pace in 2019, but Investors Don’t Love Them All

docs.abstract: The transaction would give AbbVie a potent source of popular treatments as it faces the loss of patent protection for its best-selling drug, Humira.
docs.snippet: The transaction would give AbbVie a potent source of popular treatments as it faces the loss of patent protection for its best-selling drug, Humira.
docs.lead_paragraph: The drugmaker AbbVie said on Tuesday that it planned to buy Allergan, the maker of Botox, for about $63 billion, in one of the biggest mergers in the health care industry this year.

headline.main: Botox Maker Allergan Is Sold to AbbVie in $63 Billion Deal
headline.print_headline: Agreeing to Buy Allergan, AbbVie Offers $63 Billion

byline.original: By Katie Thomas and Michael J. de la Merced
